name: Alabaster Potion
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
originalText: Target player gains X life, or prevent X damage to any creature or player.
flavor:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb

name: Battering Ram
text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

originalText:
Banding when attacking
Whenever a wall blocks Battering Ram, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

name: Bog Imp
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
originalText: Flying
flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

name: Bog Wraith
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
originalText: Swampwalk
flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

name: Circle of Protection: Black
text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from one black source. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from one red source. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

name: Clockwork Beast
text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

originalText:
When Clockwork Beast comes into play, put seven +1/+0 counters on it. At the end of any combat in which Clockwork Beast is assigned to attack or block, remove a counter.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. You may have no more than seven of these counters on Clockwork Beast. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Cursed Land
text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
originalText: During enchanted land's controller's upkeep, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to the player.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
name: Dark Ritual
text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

name: Detonate
text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

originalText: Bury target artifact with casting cost equal to X. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

name: Disintegrate
text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature cannot regenerate until end of turn. If the creature is dealt lethal damage this turn, remove it from the game.

name: Durkwood Boars
flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
flavor:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven proverb
originalText: Elven Riders cannot be blocked except by creatures with flying or walls.
name: Elven Riders

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

name: Elvish Archers
text: First strike
originalText: First strike
flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

name: Energy Flux
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
originalText: All artifacts in play gain "During your upkeep, pay an additional {2} or bury this artifact."

name: Feedback
text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
originalText: During enchanted enchantment's controller's upkeep, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
name: Fireball
text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.

If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

originalText: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, round down, among any number of target creatures and/or players. Pay an additional {1} for each target beyond the first.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

name: Glasses of Urza
text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
originalText: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

name: Healing Salve
text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
originalText: Target player gains 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

name: Hill Giant
flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Ironclaw Orcs
text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
originalText: Ironclaw Orcs cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 2 or greater.
flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Jayemdae Tome
text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

name: Lost Soul
text: Swampwalk
originalText: Swampwalk
flavor:
Her hand gently beckons,
she whispers your name—
But those who go with her
are never the same.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Mesa Pegasus
text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

originalText: Banding, flying
flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Mountain
originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

name: Murk Dwellers
text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

originalText: If Murk Dwellers attacks and is not blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.
originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
name: Orcish Artillery

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

name: Orcish Oriflamme
text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
originalText: All attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

name: Pearled Unicorn
flavor: "‘Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' ‘Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, ‘if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

name: Phantom Monster
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Plains
originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

name: Power Sink
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

originalText: Counter target spell unless that spell's caster pays an additional {X}. That player draws and pays all available mana from lands and mana pool until {X} is paid; he or she may also draw and pay mana from other sources if desired.

name: Pyrotechnics
text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me!
Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return." —Navajo war chant

name: Raise Dead
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

originalText: Put target creature card from your graveyard into your hand.

name: Reverse Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

originalText: All damage dealt to you frmo one source this turn is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted from it. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

name: Rod of Ruin
text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Scryb Sprites
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Sorceress Queen
text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
originalText: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen becomes 0/2 until end of turn.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

name: Terror
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
originalText: Bury target non-black, non-artifact creature.

name: Twiddle
text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

originalText: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand.

name: Untamed Wilds
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

name: Vampire Bats
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
originalText:
Flying
{B} +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {B}{B} in this way each turn.
flavor:
"For something is amiss or out of place
When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Wall of Bone
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
originalText: {B}: Regenerate
flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

name: War Mammoth
text: Trample
originalText: Trample
flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Warp Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
originalText: During enchanted artifact's controller's upkeep, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Weakness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

name: Whirling Dervish
text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

foreignNames.name: 疾風のデルヴィッシュ

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.

originalText:
Protection from black
At the end of any turn in which Whirling Dervish damaged any opponent, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Winter Blast
text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.

rulings.text: Winter Blast can target tapped creatures. If they have flying, the second part of the effect will still affect them.
Checks if the creatures are Flying on resolution and not on announcement. It's not a targeting restriction.

originalText: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Zephyr Falcon to tap.
flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
